org.forgerock.openig.config
Class ConfigResource

java.lang.Object
  org.forgerock.openig.config.ConfigResource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Resource
public class ConfigResource
extends Object
implements Resource

A resource for accessing application configuration data.

There are two modes the configuration resource resolve: simple and bootstrap. Simple mode is meant for single local deployments of a web application in a user account; bootstrap mode supports remotely configured or multiple deployments of an application for a given user account.

In both cases, all file resources are located a directory that is either $AppData/vendor/product/ if the $AppData environment variable is defined (typical in Windows installations), or otherwise user-home/.vendor/product/ (typical in Unix installations).

This class first tries to locate the configuration file using simple mode by looking for a file named config.json in the configuration directory specified above. If the file does not exist, then this class reverts to boostrap mode.

In bootstrap mode, the name of a bootstrap configuration resource is generated based on the instance name supplied (or dervied from the servlet context) and takes the form instance.json. This file is expected to contain a single JSON object with a single value with the name config-uri. The value is the URI of the configuration resource.
